CatDescriptText: Maria Cercone, hairdresser, McKees Rocks and Anita Haywood, Fifth Ward, were part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, June 3, 1961, pg. 7 with question: "Relative to the race riot in Montgomery, Ala., do you think the Federal Government should wait until a state asks for law enforcement help, or should the power of the United States be used immediately to protect a citizen's life when it is endangered?" Maria Cercone's answer reads: "It should be used right away.  The Federal Government shouldn't wait for a state to request help."  Anita Haywood's answer reads: "Immediately, to course.  The Federal power should be used, because the state was not taking action to protect human lives."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of Maria Cercone wearing light colored coat and head scarf, standing on street with man wearing hat and buildings in background; Portrait of Anita Haywood wearing dark coat, holding paper bag, standing on street with three men and building in background
